abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons reinforce that the
            successful implementation of the project is largely due to
            the effective partnership between the client counterparts,
            and the Bank, and to the commitment, and dynamic direction
            of the implementing agency, contributing factors to the
            excellent disbursement, and timely completion of civil
            works. This contributed to the development of an efficient
            construction industry; however, the performance of
            contractors in the smallest category, continues to be poor.
            It is thus recommended that future projects consider larger
            works for small works contracts, based on performance. An
            area for attention in the roads sector, is that of
            sustainable maintenance funding, through the establishment
            of a Roads Fund, linked to user charges, to ultimately set
            up an independent National Roads Board. Given the recurring
            annual flooding in Bangladesh, it is recommended that the
            Government be prepared for such emergencies by ensuring
            access to critical commodities, and services for immediate
            rehabilitation works, and a system for periodic maintenance
            of the road infrastructure would minimize flood damages.
            Regarding road safety, it is imperative that the Government
            conduct road safety audits, and implement an action plan
            involving stakeholders, public-private partnerships,
            communities, and nongovernmental organizations to commence
            implementing remedial measures.
